page.title: 16The Sawmill 2.
page.content: consists mainly in supplying sawn timber, supplying and erecting fencing, making gates and general agricultural woodwork such as feeding troughs and racks.Although the blacksmith's side of business lapsed 20 years ago and the majority of the ironwork is brought in from elsewhere, the forge is still in use for certain items.Mr. Grabham employs 2 full-time men who are responsible for sawing timber and erecting fences.He uses a great deal of larch wood, and some Douglas Fir, Pine and Oak.All the wood is obtained locally from the National Trust, the Forestry Commission and the Crown Estates.A 10' Larch wood field gate which before W.W. II would have cost Â£1, now costs: Gate-Â£30,Ironwork-Â£12,Gate posts-Â£18.50 = Â£60.50 plus V.A.T.-Â£ 9.05 = Â£69.55.
